intro: Leonia ferrugineosticta, commonly known as the rusty-streaked leonia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a slightly hairy surface. Leonia ferrugineosticta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
